snippet: Without a resolution on budget cuts and tax increases, schools battered by the recession could face more belt-tightening.
abstract: Impending 'fiscal cliff' crisis in January 2013 could present public schools already battered by the recession with more belt-tightening; federal education programs would lose a little over $2 billion, or close to 8 percent of current budget, starting in fall 2013; school districts nationwide are bracing for cutbacks.
lead_paragraph: Without a resolution on budget cuts and tax increases, schools battered by the recession could face more belt-tightening.

headline.seo: U.S. School Districts, Eyeing Fiscal Crisis, Brace for More Cutbacks
headline.main: School Districts Brace for Cuts as Fiscal Crisis Looms
headline.print_headline: School Districts, Eyeing Looming Debt Crisis, Brace for More Cutbacks
